subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Keyboard mappings and keyboard layouts
msgSnippet: Thanks for updating the file. When looking at individual letters, I liked the first QS-Nu assignments, too. But when I started translating lists of words (easy
messageBody:
Thanks for updating the file.

When looking at individual letters, I liked the first QS-Nu
assignments, too. But when I started translating lists of words (easy
to do using the CMU Dictionary), I found that time after time the BPJ2
assignments resulted in more readable words.

Ted


On Jan 7, 2008 5:36 PM, Anthony Hagan <anthonydh@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ted Larson Freeman"
>
> <freeman@...> wrote:
> > QS-Nu has been updated since then. (See the
> > file 'qs_keybd_proposals.csv' and earlier email discussion.)
>
> I've updated my keyboard grids for the current version of QS-Nu, and
> also included markers for the controversial mappings. Please let me
> know if any proposals have been misrepresented. I'll try to keep up
> with future amendments. (But I won't promise quick updates.)
>
> To be honest, I preferred the previous version of QS-Nu, particularly
> the assignment of TO vowel letter names to matching QS sounds (i.e.
> #29Eight->A, #27Eat->E, #31I->I, #38Owe->O and #40Ooze->U.) Oh well...
>
>
